page.title: 19Transport
page.content: The{Montrose}Local Plan of June 1980 has highlighted the main issues relating to transport.They include trends in road traffic volumes through the town centre;parking provision; accident patterns;public transport services and harbour and airfield traffic. A Relief road is badly needed for{ {Montrose,}but problems have arisen in finding a suitable route.Disagreements have occured over this matter. Most accidents occur on the A92 route from Bridge Street to Brechin Road.The High Street parking problem is mainly due to careless public parking. The Ball House square has now been made into a pedestrian precinct. Problems are caused by the increased number of lorries passing through the town.It is well served by bus,rail and taxi services.
